data: This page will give you a brief overview of how to authenticate with the API.
data.login#Login:
The login route is at /auth/login. It accepts a POST request with the following parameters:
email - The email address of the user
password - The password of the user

Response
{
"user": {
"role": "Freelancer",
"username": "phantomknight287",
"id": "clf40vl0t0000ewroucp805xe",
"name": "Gurpal Singh",
"profileCompleted": true
},
"token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6ImNsZjQwdmwwdDAwMDBld3JvdWNwODA1eGUiLCJyb2xlIjoiRnJlZWxhbmNlciIsImlhdCI6MTY3ODk0NTM5Mn0.SpE-8ArMpDOHic6EgqpSUPkxM5h6vNPLxEr8CNvN7rQ"
}
The token will be used for further requests to the API.
data.register#Register:
The register route is at /auth/register. It accepts a POST request with the following parameters:
email - The email address of the user
password - The password of the user
confirmPassword - The password of the user
country - The country of the user(optional, Default set to India)
role - The role of the user(either Freelancer or Client)
name - The name of the user

Response:
{
"user": {
"role": "Freelancer",
"username": "phantomknight287",
"id": "clf40vl0t0000ewroucp805xe",
"name": "Gurpal Singh",
"profileCompleted": false
},
"token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6ImNsZjQwdmwwdDAwMDBld3JvdWNwODA1eGUiLCJyb2xlIjoiRnJlZWxhbmNlciIsImlhdCI6MTY3ODk0NTM5Mn0.SpE-8ArMpDOHic6EgqpSUPkxM5h6vNPLxEr8CNvN7rQ"
}
The token will be used for further requests to the API.

data: The routes will be used to fetch or create categories.
These are the api docs for Lend My Skill. The real reason behind these docs is to help you understand how to use the api and help new contributors understand the codebase.
This api route is to perform CR operations on job posts. It is used to create, and get job posts.
data.create-job-post#Create Job Post:
POST /job-postRequest Body
{
"title": "title",
"description": "description",
"price": 100, // optional, in USD,
"tags": ["tag id 1", "tag id 2", "tag id 3"], // max 5,
"category": "category id",
"images": ["img 1", "img 2", "img 3"], // url returned from upload image api
"deadline": "2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" // optional, ISO 8601 format
}
Response
{
"slug": "title-2f4gdsssd"
}

data: These routes will be used to fetch and update user profiles.
data.fetch-profile-of-authenticated-user#Fetc:
GET /profile
Warning: Authorization header must be provided

{
"id": "clf40vl0t0000ewroucp805xe",
"name": "Gurpal Singh",
"username": "phantomknight287",
"profileCompleted": true,
"role": "Freelancer",
"avatarUrl": "images/clf40vl0t0000ewroucp805xe-173d5448-7508-49c6-9131-d74ea8f9b7d7-1678544261104-30fa3134-c144-40a0-a9a5-4238adf8fdc0-74ypssi41rma1.jpg",
"bio": "Hey there 12242",
"country": "India"
}
data.update-profile-of-authenticated-user#Upd:
POST /profile/update
Warning: Authorization header must be provided
Request Body
avatarUrl - URL of the avatar image provided by upload routes(optional)
country - Country of the user (optional)
bio - Bio of the user (optional)

Response
{
"updated": true
}
data.completing-a-users-profile#Completing a:
POST /profile/complete
Warning: Authorization header must be provided
Request Body
documents - Array of document URLs provided by upload routes
paypalEmail - PayPal email of the user(optional)
upiId - UPI ID of the user(optional)
mobileNumber - Mobile number of the user


Warning:  either paypalEmail or upiId must be provided
Response
Profile Completed

data: These routes can be used to fetch and create services.

data: These routes will be used by Nextjs for ISR
The routes will be used to fetch or create tags.
This route will be used to upload content like images,videos, documents etc to the server.
data.uploading-single-file#Uploading Single F:
Make a multipart/form-data request to the /upload route with the file to be uploaded in the file field.
Warning: The file size limit is 10MB.

Warning: Authorization header must be provided
Optional query parameters:
to - The folder to which the file should be uploaded in supabase. If not provided, the file will be uploaded to the images folder.

Response
{
"path": "assets/a-long-random-string-randomUUID-filename.extension"
}
To use the uploaded file, you can use the path returned in the and prefix it with STORAGE_BUCKET_URL environment variable.
data.uploading-multiple-files#Uploading Multi:
Make a multipart/form-data request to the /upload route with the files to be uploaded in the files field.
Warning: The file size limit is 10MB.

Warning: Authorization header must be provided
Optional query parameters:
to - The folder to which the file should be uploaded in supabase. If not provided, the file will be uploaded to the images folder.

Response
{
"paths": ["url1.jpg", "url2.jpg"]
}
